qas.question: What companies have been involved with wrongdoing?
What do Johnson & Johnson marketing cases fall under?

context: Every major company selling the antipsychotics — <a3_0><b12_0>Bristol-Myers Squibb, Eli Lilly, Pfizer, AstraZeneca and Johnson & Johnson<b12_0/><a3_0/> — has either settled recent government cases, under the <a4_0><a5_0><b13_0>False Claims Act<b13_0/><a5_0/><a4_0/>, for hundreds of millions of dollars or is currently under investigation for possible health care fraud. Following charges of illegal marketing, two of the settlements set records last year for the largest criminal fines ever imposed on corporations. One involved <a6_0>Eli Lilly<a6_0/>'s antipsychotic <a1_0><b10_0>Zyprexa, and the other involved Bextra<b10_0/><a1_0/>. In the Bextra case, the government also charged Pfizer with illegally marketing another antipsychotic, <a2_0><a7_0><b11_0>Geodon<b11_0/><a7_0/><a2_0/>; Pfizer settled that part of the claim for <a0_0><a8_0><b9_0>$301 million<b9_0/><a8_0/><a0_0/>, without admitting any wrongdoing.
